thread.title: Texas state trooper in trouble for photo with Cowboys' player
thread.title_full: Texas state trooper in trouble for photo with Cowboys' player

author:
John Hickey

jhickey@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: Texas state trooper in trouble for photo with Cowboys' player
text:
Texas state trooper in trouble for photo with Cowboys' player By John Hickey Posted: 10/13/2015 06:17:42 PM PDT Updated: 10/13/2015 06:17:44 PM PDT A Texas trooper is in hot water after having his photo taken with Cowboys' running back Christine Michael during a traffic stop. Stephen Lister, a trooper with 6Â½ years on the job, pulled Michael's black Bentley over because the car appeared to violate state laws on tinted windows, the Texas Department of Public Safety said Tuesday. No citation was issued, but according to SPS Sgt. Lonny Haschel, "the trooper had Mr. Michael step out of the vehicle for a picture. A passenger in the player's car took the photo.'' 
That might have been the end of it, but Michael posted the photo on Instagram with the caption: "Got stopped just to take a picture.'' Advertisement
